snippet: The good news was tempered by a warning from economists that the global economy had weakened since May.
abstract: Commerce Department reports the United States trade deficit fell 3.8 percent to $48.68 billion in May, down from $50.6 billion in April; exports rose 0.2 percent to $183.1 billion, while imports fell 0.7 percent to $231.8 billion.
lead_paragraph: The good news was tempered by a warning from economists that the global economy had weakened since May.

headline.seo: U.S. Trade Deficit Declined in May
headline.main: U.S. Trade Deficit Declined in May
headline.print_headline: U.S. Trade Deficit Declined in May
